instructions1: In order to setup an item search, create a new file in the 'searches' folder and copy contents of this 'templateSearch.json' file into that newly created file
instructions2: Then in that new file, fill in the fields that you want to search for
instructions4: All values you enter need to be in quotes, just like those instructions are
instructions5: Numeric values can be with or without quotes, they can be integer or decimals, for decimals use '.' for decimal point like so: 1.5
instructions6: Boolean values can be either 'true' or 'false'
instructions7: You can delete all the fields that are not needed, as well as all the '_comment' lines - so that the file is more readable
instructions8: You can also remove all 'instructions' and 'section' lines
searchDescription_comment: Description of the item you are looking for - it's not used in search algorithm but rather it's for your convenience, e.g. 'Coil 115/75'
identified_comment: Whether item is identified or not (true/false)
corrupted_comment: Whether item is corrupted or not (true/false)
socketsAndLinks_comment1: String representing number of sockets and links in the following format:
socketsAndLinks_comment2: xSyL where x is number of sockets and y is number of linked sockets, e.g. '6S5L' is 5-link with 6 sockets
socketsAndLinks_comment3: you can also just provide number of sockets, or just number of links e.g. '4L' or '6S'
socketColors_comment: String representing socket colors R represents red, G - green, B - blue, e.g. RRGGB is 2 red, 2 gree and 1 blue
note_comment: What should be on the note that people can attach to the item
buyoutOnly_comment: Whether only priced item should be matched (true/false)
maxPriceCurrency_comment: Maximum price, just the currency - recognized currency names are listed in 'data/currencyNames.json'
section2_comment: Remove this entire section if you are not looking for map
section3_comment: Remove this entire section if you are not looking for gem
gemIsMaxLevel_comment1: Wheter gem can be levelled up more (true/false)
gemIsMaxLevel_comment2: E.g. gemMinGemLevel: 19, gemIsMaxLevel: true means corrupted gem that can't be levelled to 20
section4_comment: Remove this entire section if you are not looking for armour/shield
armourMinArmour_comment: Minimum Armour value given maximum item quality (integer)
armourMaxArmour_comment: Maximum Armour value given maximum item quality (integer)
armourMinEvasion_comment: Minimum Evasion value given maximum item quality (integer)
armourMaxEvasion_comment: Maximum Evasion value given maximum item quality (integer)
armourMinEnergyShield_comment: Minimum Energy Shield value given maximum item quality (integer)
armourMaxEnergyShield_comment: Maximum Energy Shield value given maximum item quality (integer)
section5_comment: Remove this entire section if you are not looking for weapon
weaponType_comment: Weapon type - supported weapon types are listed in 'data/weaponTypes.json'
weaponMinDps_comment: Minimum weapon total DPS given maxiumum item quality (integer/decimal)
weaponMaxDps_comment: Maximum weapon total DPS given maxiumum item quality (integer/decimal)
weaponMinPhysicalDps_comment: Minimum weapon physical DPS given maxiumum item quality (integer/decimal)
weaponMaxPhysicalDps_comment: Maximum weapon physical DPS given maxiumum item quality (integer/decimal)
implicitMods_comments2: List of supported mods names can be found in 'data/modNames.json'
implicitMods_comments3: You must copy the mod name from that file EXACTLY as it's listed
implicitMods_comments4: When removing empty mod slots, make sure that the last modName-modValue pair DOES NOT have comma after it
explicitMods_comments2: List of supported mods names can be found in 'data/modNames.json'
explicitMods_comments3: You must copy the mod name from that file EXACTLY as it's listed
explicitMods_comments4: When removing empty mod slots, make sure that the last { modName - modValue } pair DOES NOT have comma after it
